## Background

The R Contribution Working Group was set up in July 2020

::: {.larger150}
> to foster a larger, **more diverse** community of contributors to the R Project
:::

How have we integrated EDIA in our work?

## Kick-off meeting

Gathered >25 people

- R Project leaders: R Core, R Foundation
- EDIA-focused orgs: Forwards, R Consortium Diversity & Inclusion Group
- Affinity groups: R-Ladies, RUG Buenos Aires
- External experts: Women on Python Core

Impact: identified problems, prioritised tasks, shaped our approach

::: {.notes}
E.g. choice of Slack for communication, funding people where possible
:::

## Collaboration Campfires

[Code for Science & Society Digital Infrastructure Incubator](https://www.codeforsociety.org/incubator/projects/building-community-around-the-r-development-guide)
funded Saranjeet Kaur Bhogal

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="50%"}

* Designed for newbies
    - Reviewed with community champions
* Targeted outreach to people from underrepresented groups (URG)
    - Slacks/social media
    - Social media followers
    - Podcast
:::

![](images/collaboration-campfires.jpg)

:::: {.columns}

## Summary

* Consult widely
* Meet people where they are
* Target outreach at group and individual level
* Collaborate with people from URG
* Let people from URG lead and take ownership
* Fund where possible!
